Posts.Content: Has anyone gone to Cancer Treatments of America? Thoughts???
Posts.Title: Cancer Treament Centers of America

Posts.Content: The doctor told us that the prostate is to enlarged that he would need to much radiation to kill it.That why surgery first.And he just figures with the high psa numbers its escaped the prostate.....
Posts.Title: Some advice

Posts.Content: I guess I need some advice.My husband was just diagnosed on Jan. 26 th. Had bone scans and Mri all clear.The pathology report came back all 12 cores had cancer in them,all were 4+3.Most were 80-90% 2 of them had a comment that said may be a tertiary score of 5 with single and sinet ring cells.Psa numbers were 48.15 and 70.16.......we have surgery scheduled for early march,the doctor feel it has already came out of the prostate already and he plans on taking all the nerves and lymph nodes too.He feels then HT and radiation after a few months.We are just shocked my husband is just 50 went in for a check-up no symptoms at all. Any advice.We know this is serious.We now have a request for a 2nd opinion.We really like our dr.My concern first is kick the cancer then the rest of the stuff comes later........
Posts.Title: Some advice

Posts.Title: Some advice

Posts.Content: He is 51 and he had Da Vinci surgery.They don't want to wait too long for radiation because its so aggressive.He is 3 wks out from surgery.He is dry all night and just wears 1 pad during the day.The dr.feels if he isn't continent by the time of radiation he feels he can put in a artificial sphincter.
Posts.Title: Not what we expected

Posts.Content: His biopsy was all 12 positive with 4+3, his psa as 70.76.How do we know if the Lupron is really working for him though? if they aren't going to check until June? He has no side effects and his testerone hasn't dropped yet.Does it take awhile to work?
Posts.Title: Not what we expected

Posts.Content: My husband had a 8 hr. surgery because the cancer had multiple positive margins in the the bladder neck and right an left anterior quadrants, right seminal vesicle was present.Lymph-vascular areas suspicious for aniolymphatic invasion were identified.Pathologic staging.pT4NOMO stage 4.So he has had a shot of Lupron and will start radiation 1-2 months.Dr doesn't want to wait long being it spead so fast from the scans in 5 weeks.His urologist say incurable, but oncologist thinks 50/50 any thoughts?I pray that it will be cured,but after reading his stats not sure.......
Posts.Title: Not what we expected
